website_summaries.verdict: A unique yard tool by a trusted brand and a good option for consumers with small to medium yards. Multiple purposes make it a good deal.
pros: Unique 3-in-1 design: a mower, trimmer, and edger in one
cons: Not for large lawns or tall, tough grass and weeds

customer_reviews.title: I really do like it. Works great but the plug situation was ...
customer_reviews.text: So here is my take on this. I really do like it. Works great but the plug situation was poorly thought out. The unit has a recessed circle with a two prong plug inside. Being that this is a unit that should really need grounded that made no sense to me. And any long outdoor extension cords won't fit in the hole. If it weren't for that this would get five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Halosnhippos

customer_reviews.title: Great for our 300sqft area
customer_reviews.text: I have a 300sqft area on my back patio that I recently laid sod on. This is the grass after almost 3 weeks of watering and letting the roots grow. This 3 in 1 did great! Exactly what we needed.Something powerful enough, no gas, easy to store in a small place and includes the weedeater and edger features (<-- which is a huge plus).
customer_reviews.author: Mr & Mrs J

customer_reviews.title: Terrible mower, decent weed eater/edger
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent weed eater/edger, the wheel makes it really easy to edge and run along a wall/fence. As a mower it is terrible. It is constantly popping off the mower attachment. It gets clogged up very easy. Only works when I am pulling it backwards. If I push it forward it doesn't cut the grass. It chews through cord, I have to replace the spool at least twice per mow. Just a small front and fenced in backyard. The electrical cord (sold separately) is SUPER annoying, makes the job so much more difficult. Buying a cheap gas mower for the next time I have to mow. At least I have an alright weed eater though.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah C.

customer_reviews.title: Best Tool EVER! Great job Black+Decker!
customer_reviews.text: This was the best purchase I have ever made. As a female, new homeowner with a small yard, I wasn't sure what would be my best option but then I found this. It is light weight, easy to assemble, easy to squeeze the button, easy to plug in, easy to attach and detach the mower part, and it easily hangs on my garage wall. It is almost like I was simply vacuuming my lawn. I would recommend this product to everyone. Great job Black+Decker!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small but ok
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED AFTER A COUPLE MONTHS USE. The string keeps snapping off when trimming edges that are near the sidewalk. It’s difficult to replace and not cheap. Minus 1 star. This is pretty lightweight and so lacks power. My lawn takes several passes before it cuts through everything. You have to be very careful because it seems not super sturdy. I like that it doesn’t use gas or a battery. Some people might not like dragging an extension cord around, but I prefer it. I don’t expect much obviously because of the low price. It does a decent job but is not for thick/long grass or a big yard.
customer_reviews.author: Tee

customer_reviews.title: Weed Wacker is great. Wheels are worthless.
customer_reviews.text: The electric weed wacker itself is great. Study. Runs and runs. It’s very easy to replace the line and you can find it at any store really. But if you’re buying this for the “lawnmower” wheels...don’t. You have to use it on your grass like a vacuum on carpet going back and forth over the same area, it’s so light weight you have to push down to keep it on the ground flat, it doesn’t cut well, and it makes doing the yard 10x more work than it needs to be. You’re better off just wacking the yard by hand. Used the wheels once and threw them away. Great trimmer though.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn O'Donnell

customer_reviews.title: Very light and great for weed eating and edging but mowing is fair at best.
customer_reviews.text: The unit is very light and it weed eats and edges well but sometimes the clamps come loose and the handles move while you are using it. As far as mowing, it does not "click" in the mowing unit easily and even on the lowest setting, does not really "mow" as a what you would see with an actual mower. It requires you to go over the same spots a couple of times and even from opposite direction if the blade bends the first time over. I would only recommend this for actual mowing if you have a very tiny space to mow. My areas are not very large, but really not what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Kay J.

customer_reviews.title: It would rather be an edger/trimmer than a mower
customer_reviews.text: The chintzy plastic lip that is supposed to keep the trimmer body securely attached to the mower base constantly gives way if you push the mower off a sidewalk onto the grass. I used to have a Black & Decker electric trimmer/edger that cost me around $27. The base that is supposed to make this serve as a grass mower is worth about...well it's worth nothing if it doesn't effectively serve that purpose. Out nearly $90 I could have spent on a manual push mower and probably saved myself a load of grief and string of shouted expletives.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J. Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Awesome trimmer and mower
customer_reviews.text: It's simply awesome. I could not believe it will cut trough tall overgrown grass. It did, though it's only 0.0065" trim line, it makes great job by cutting everything on it's way. I used it simply as a vacuum, in additions some weeds required to go over from side, to make a perfect cut. In one hour I could finish half of the backyard which usually took me few hours with a regular cordless 56v trimmer, with a ticker line. It feels very light, end easy to maneuver. As well it drastically easier, and not gives you any back pains, like the cordless one gave me.
customer_reviews.author: FluffyPaws

customer_reviews.title: Nope...
customer_reviews.text: If you have a tiny lawn like us, you don't see the point in a full-size lawnmower. We got this and because it's not a mower (string to cut the lawn, not blades) but it spread grass and weeds everywhere. Even assisted the spread of dollar weed. We wound up getting a blade mower. Largely because we got sick of re-sodding (HoA requires sod).
customer_reviews.author: CrazyHorrorGirl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little mower!
customer_reviews.text: I have a tiny lawn, less than a quarter acre including the house. There's a lot of flowerbeds, etc. This is perfect for me. The picture is of a 3 week old lawn. I have it 4 instead of 5 because the cord comes out easily. Also, I don't know if it's it or the cheap ass twine from hellmart, but it EATS the twine. I'm going to order some off here and see if that helps. Also, not sure how to post my pic. Hopefully I can figure it out. You will have to go over spots, but that's true with a push mower.
customer_reviews.author: Debby Johnson

customer_reviews.title: What a great option for a (really) small lawn
customer_reviews.text: Our new house has a patch of grass the size of a living room; but since we were away for 4 months, the grass was getting pretty high when I ordered this item. So, I used the weed wacker feature to get the grass down to a reasonable height, then (easily) snapped it into the mower base to make the grass level, then finished off by (easily) switching to the edger mode. Soooo glad I purchased this item!! Sure works for my lawn. And, so lightweight!
customer_reviews.author: Glenda

customer_reviews.title: Does the job Just not made for rough handling
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use in the back yard which is quite small. I was using just a weed eater and trying to get an even cut was tiring. This weed eater mower works really well and I only have to remove the mower piece to trim the edges and the fence line. The mower piece will pop off the weed eater somewhat easily if you are using it a little rough though.Other than that it does the job and my little piece of yard looks more even when I'm done.
customer_reviews.author: Allen R. Dean

customer_reviews.title: Trim and Mow
customer_reviews.text: Neighbors wanted to know where I got the new gadget. Wife likes it because it goes around the decorative stones in the flowerbed. Easy to pop off pop back in the carriage. Maneuvering is easy, though I’ve had to use it vacuum cleaner style “back and forth motion” and wheels are not adjustable, but as I said wife like it so that’s the key.
customer_reviews.author: Real World Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Don't purchase three prong extension cords with this product.
customer_reviews.text: Don't purchase the 16/3 extension cord recommended with this weed eater. The weed eater is a two prong male and the extension cord is a grounded (three prong) female that is too big around and will not fit. You will need to go to your local hardware store and purchased an adapter - two prong female to three prong male. To be fair, I rated because it was required but I can't try it or even turn it on until I get to a hardware store tomorrow. The product seems to be very light weight, I hope it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stay seated, pops off easily.  Gearing wears down too easily.
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm the first 4-5 times I used it ( I only have 600 sq feet of lawn to trim). Then the trimmer would get unseated from the base and pop off when I didn't want it to. After 4 short months, the spool housing no longer engages with the motor. It simply does not spin and the unit has been rendered useless. I had a 20v B&D LST400 as well that recently stopped working, the motor wore down and doesn't spin fast enough to cut grass. At least that one, though, was 3 years old.
customer_reviews.author: D. Nakano

customer_reviews.title: This is a good trimmer for light to moderate yard work.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good tool for doing light to moderate mowing and trimming. Easy and simple to assemble. One problem is the trimmer is easy to snap into the mower deck and easy to take out. Too easy. I have had the trimmer come out when being moved around and sometimes difficult to get it to stay back in. I bought this powered trimmer so that I did not have to deal with a battery that might go bad. Also if you use a battery power tool, you still have to have power to charge the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Silver Fox

customer_reviews.title: The trimmer detaches for use separately and does a fine job.
customer_reviews.text: This is plenty enough mower if you have a tiny yard, such as at a condo or townhouse. To be clear, the "mower" is really just a plastic platform with wheels, so you can push the trimmer around evenly versus if you were trying to cut your lawn with the trimmer freehand style. The trimmer detaches for use separately and does a fine job.
customer_reviews.author: A guy in Maryland

customer_reviews.title: Bad customer service
customer_reviews.text: A good concept but i wanted a battery operated not an electric now trying to send it back but without success please check their return policies before purchasing from this company frankly its a bit annoying to try and get a pp mailing label they don't pay for returns 20 percent restock fee on top of that smh never again...... Read the small print first save yourself the aggregation
customer_reviews.author: darlene g

customer_reviews.title: “Mows” down those weeds.
customer_reviews.text: With the base, this trimmer works great on large areas of weeds. I’m 72 and holding a trimmer for long periods is difficult. So this really helps. However, I cannot see this as being good to use as a mower for a small lawn because there are only two adjustments for height and both would cut grass too short. The trimmer alone works fine for weeds also, but I found it difficult to use as an edger. I have an actual electric edger that does a lot better job and is easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Lady on the lake

customer_reviews.title: I love this! I have mowed with damp
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I have mowed with damp, tall grass and it works like a charm. I really like that I can instantly use it as an edger (I like the wheel that allow me to just roll it along the ground) and into an edger. The only problem I have had, when I sometimes back up while mowing, it comes out of the base. Even when I snap it in good, it will come out. That is mainly when the grass is higher and harder to pull through. Here, we have to cut the grass every Saturday, even then, it is tall grass, since it grows so fast.
customer_reviews.author: katpink

customer_reviews.title: I love this.
customer_reviews.text: I love this...!!! This is the best thing I've bought in 10 years....I'm a 77 year old lady and this let's me care for my little lawn. So easy to use, it's like vacuuming the grass. and when I need to trim I just remove the trimmer from the trolley and I'm good to go. My neighbor borrows it all the time. He loves it too. This is the second one I've owned...The trimmer head broke after 3 years and I was so happy to find that this was still available. I've saved the broken trimmer and hope it can be repaired, then my neighbor will have his own "Magic Mower". --That's what we call it.
customer_reviews.author: AgnesMooney

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: When I first presented this to my husband, he asked "what am i I supposed to do with this?" He was surprised that it actually worked... it looks so delicate. He said it feels more like vaccuuming than mowing... it even got the attention of many of our neighbors, that wandered over to ask, "whats that?" We have a small lawn, this is more than adequate. It doesnt have a means to catch grass, so there is some extra sidewalk, etc clean up added to the mowing task, but, its no big deal. Its eady to use, easy to store, and mukti tadking. Its a winner!
customer_reviews.author: Momma1

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended!
customer_reviews.text: This BLACK + DECKER 3-in-1 trimmer/trimming machine and lawn mower is very convenient to use. It can meet all your yard requirements at the same time without spending a lot of money, but the disappointing thing is the lawn mower The quality of the connection with the deck is too poor, and the buckles that are connected to each other can’t be fastened at all. When I mow the lawn, the lawn mower keeps loosening, and the grass debris and pebbles will keep hitting me and my face. Too dangerous...I have to choose to return
customer_reviews.author: Zoe

customer_reviews.title: Black+Decker MTE912 is just wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I am 76 & recovering from an accident. I bought this unit because I could no longer use a gas mower & edger. The 6.5-Amp Electric is just wonderful! It is light weight, easy to use and works very well. I will NEVER go back to anything except an electric one. I hope these become available again for others who need just a little assistance.
customer_reviews.author: Jihada A

customer_reviews.title: Amazing invention with added bonus!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this corded 3 in 1 so my grandson could mow my yard without the fear of getting electrocuted by running over the electric cord with my old monster electric mower. It works beautifully!!! But even better I discovered that my old battery powered Black and Decker 12 inch BATTERY operated string trimmer fits perfectly so now I have 2 options for mowing!!! Corded or battery powered! I LOVE BLACK AND DECKER TOOLS!
customer_reviews.author: MariansGrandmother

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my small yard! Perfect that it converts and multi use, easy to adjust height (a little confusing at first to figure out, but only took a few minutes playing with the wheels to see how to do it). Easier to use than a vacuum! We bought the corded one, as we've had battery trimmers in the past and they quickly lose the ability to hold a charge, are expensive to replace so often. I am very happy with this one! Although it is LOUD, more than I had expected otherwise I would have given 5 stars, but it does the job perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Ward

customer_reviews.title: It is light weight almost like you are vacuming which is nice
customer_reviews.text: The piece you tap with your foot that should hold it better when you try and pick it up to move it comes apart while you still have it on you have to becareful not to cut your leg not recommended for younger kids to use I used it twice and now have to replace the line not sure if it my fault or it is breaking easily? Kind of a down fall but it is very useful
customer_reviews.author: renee

customer_reviews.title: Feels cheap, but works really well.
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised! While the weight of this mower is reminiscent of a Kinder Surprise toy, the results of using it are rather impressive for a smallish yard. Weed was out of control at our place, yet the tool did a great job at annihilating it all in very little time. We were worried that the weight of the trimmer when not attached to the base would get very heavy quickly, but that wasn't the case. I will update this review after several months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Leonia

customer_reviews.title: Perfect amps for small yard
customer_reviews.text: Perfect weight and height adjustable features for me. Easy assembly too. First time using and very satisfied with the weed eater. Still trying to get the wheel adjuster so I can use the mower component. Not enough information but found that turning the feed line left or right seems to work. Tends to want to come out of the mower part so must be careful elevating the handle. The release is simple.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, lightweight, small to store!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little guy. Definitely for lawns that are already maintained rather than an area that needs beating back. Gets grumpy with longer unwieldy grass. My children help out with this handy dandy little weed whacker with wheels. We always wondered the bottom to keep things from getting mucked up. Make sure you follow the arrow directions for loading new string! We went through a time where it want loading it was unloading all of the string at once and it was because the strong wasn't being loaded correctly! Love it! Light weight, easy to store, electric operated.
customer_reviews.author: M. C.

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my little 10 x 15 foot back yard. It is the perfect size. You would think that since the mechanical part of this is actually a weed wacker/edger, that it would just cut the grass unevenly and just chew them up. Not so. This works very well with the mower housing attachment. My only problem is that there is a lot of finely chopped grass under the mower attachment when you are done, which requires a hose sprayer to remove the clumps. But other than that, I'm glad that I found this little guy! Makes my yardwork a whole lot easier!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for females!!! And makes too of course!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this! So light weight and wipes out everything in its path. I use it as a lawn mower . I am 68 years old and I cannot hold a gas weed eater very long. I plug this animal in and go. Easy to assemble and is self feeding. I also purchased the 60’ extension cord on a reel and a few additional line refills. Kept the box just in case it didn’t workout. Threw that in the trash the minute I used it. I haven’t tried the edger part and may never. Worth the mower part alone!
customer_reviews.author: Mercedes Blonde

customer_reviews.title: Small mower and lightweight and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: When I first started to use this mower it didn't seem like it was going to be very good at cutting grass, but after I started using it for a while, I just loved it. It is very easy to use and lightweight, which is very important to me. I have only used it once but I really like it and I think it is going to be just what I wanted. I used to say, why doesn't someone invent a small, lightweight mower that is easy to use, and here it is.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: MTE912 does NOT use batteries
customer_reviews.text: This product works well HOWEVER the product details say "Charge Time at 100 percent 4 hrs. Charge Time at 60 percent 2.5 hrs" which implies that model number MTE912 uses batteries. It does NOT use batteries. It requires an electrical extension cord which is not what I wanted. The cord makes simple jobs cumbersome and difficult. I am going to keep the mower deck however, and buy a compatible CORDLESS trimmer. The corded trimmer can go bye bye.
customer_reviews.author: Scot Gossage

customer_reviews.title: It has a powerful motor and cut grass effectively, but the auto feeder system is suck.
customer_reviews.text: It has a powerful motor and cut grass effectively, but the auto feeder system is suck. It work well with original trimming line spool, but it will be consumed quickly, and if you try to refill it you self, it could stuck many times just for a few minutes grass cutting. I would prefer the old fashion mechanical trimmer line feeder. The auto feeder is suck, therefore, I give it 3 stars. OW, I will give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Samson Yang

customer_reviews.title: It is a work horse!
customer_reviews.text: A very powerful trimmer for the money. I knew the cord would be limiting, but it handled some very overgrown areas with ease. The only issue was the trimmer came out of the mower base several times. I’m curious to see if that happens next time on shorter grass and weeds.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great for a Condo yard small area
customer_reviews.text: After using it a couple of times I find you have to always run it over the same area at least once. I find you have to clean the underside after three or four uses. I gave it only four stars because you have to run over the same area more than once. I have St. Augustine Grass what could be the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Capt Bob

customer_reviews.title: Easier than Vacuuming!
customer_reviews.text: Just used this for the first time, and love it! I'm 65 years old, 5'2" tall, 95 lbs and have a back problem. My yard is 75 x 150. This mower is lighter than my vacuum, and because the wheels are bigger, it's even easier to maneuver. I even mowed inside the screen tent! My hand got tired from constantly depressing the switch to keep it going, so I tied it in the on position with a piece of cord - problem solved. Extremely happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Frank H

customer_reviews.title: Get a lawnmover instead
customer_reviews.text: This thing is heavy. You'll have to push it really hard. Free advise - do not use it on overgrown glass, even slightly overgrown. I go frustrated, I now pay $100 a month to my gardner. If you have a tiny front/backyard, do not waste your money on this, go get a full fledge lawn mover. This was causing me to do double the work - first mow the lawn and then pick up the mulch.
customer_reviews.author: Karan C.

customer_reviews.title: Good, but
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, except the plastic parts are so fragile. The cap that holds the string broke off after a few uses. Also the string replacement is not cheap, but I can live with that since I don't have to wrap and tie the string each time; You just replace the whole thing each time. I'm giving one star, because I don't know how to replace that cap and the thing deemed useless now.
customer_reviews.author: Anton

customer_reviews.title: Not really for mowing.
customer_reviews.text: As a weed whacker, it’s fine. However, don’t expect much from this as a solution to mowing. I’ve used it in pinch when the mower broke and it gets the job done, albeit painfully. The cutting circumference is small and the turning ability of the platform is poor. Use this for mowing emergencies only.
customer_reviews.author: VeggieRunners

customer_reviews.title: I love this! I bought it for our seasonal campsite ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I bought it for our seasonal campsite that has a smaller yard. I bought the corded version because i didnt want to wait for the battery to charge once we get there. The cord the was recommended to bundle with this (the amazon basics 16/3 vinyl Outdoor Extension Cord - 50 feet) and the plug part of the mower doesnt allow enough space for the plug of the extension cord. Thankfully I had an old extension cord that i could plug into the mower and then the newer cord.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for small areas - huge time saver!
customer_reviews.text: I have heavy duty equipment and yet, around small areas, and by the pool - this trimmer / edger / mower works awesome. Black and Decker has done this right!
customer_reviews.author: S R. Sims

customer_reviews.title: Great little mower
customer_reviews.text: Just received the mower and am really impressed! Our grass was thick and very green. It trimmed it like a champ. When I went to do the edging I ended up breaking the string and didn’t have any extra because it only comes with what’s on the edger. So buy some string for the edging when you make your purchase! I do wish it had a bag for the mower. The cut grass just goes back onto the yard. So maybe invest in a leaf blower or rack up the clippings? I’m not sure Overall it’s a great little mower. It’s very lightweight. Lighter than our vacuum cleaner but does a great job!
customer_reviews.author: Allie Elms

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small yard!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little mower/weedeater! I have a very small yard and perimeter fence that I have to maintain, and this mower is as easy to use as a vaccuum cleaner. It is quiet, efficient, and easy to store away when not in use. Highly recommend it for small yards!
customer_reviews.author: cattail101

customer_reviews.title: Great for small yards (<1000ft2)
customer_reviews.text: Great combination product, with tempered expectations. Not absolutely great at any one thing, but more than adequate altogether. The mower works well enough to pass HOA inspections, the trimmer works nicely, and the edger is plenty satisfactory once you get used to where the line travels. I deducted 1 star for the horrible included spool of line (maybe I got a bad batch of line?). WHEN you buy a new, replacement spool of line (e.g. Amazon ID B00004R9TK), you see a marked improvement. Do not get this product if you have medium-to-large lawns (over 1000ft2). Instead buy a small rotary mower or a standard gas mower.
customer_reviews.author: J. E. Kline

customer_reviews.title: Cut height too low
customer_reviews.text: I'm writing this review nearly 2 years after I bought the product. I love how small and light it is. Unfortunately there's only 2 cut heights (short & shorter). It means I have no option to keep my grass average in height. It also means if I go a week without cutting it I need to rake the excess grass off the lawn, because it's so much grass the clippings will kill the lawn. Going a week and using the trimmer also means I'm cutting it so short I may shock the grass. Great product but simply not having a normal cut height makes it virtually useless for me.
customer_reviews.author: sleeps

customer_reviews.title: This issue deserves your attention Black & Decker
customer_reviews.text: This product was in immediate need of modification after it's first use. Plastic ridge holding front of motor assembly to mobile unit cracked leaving no support. THE FIX= take 2 metal rod large enough in diameter to fit in slots of motor case where the two come together. Make them about 6 inches plus that which is in motor case. This will stop motor unit from releasing it's position on wheel carrier. Simple fix, should be designed as such or at least send revised kit of two rods as explained. To Black & Decker this fix is so easy and inexpensive it deserves attention, contact me.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Delmazzo

customer_reviews.title: My wife isn't afraid to use it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little unit for a small property. Easy to use and works well. Just need an extension cord to reach all of your property.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher L

customer_reviews.title: Edger & Lawn Mower,
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this. I tried it out but I don't think it is as low as I need it to be and there is no adjustment so I just used the weed wacker and it worked great. I have one like it and have used it for a few years but now it isn't feeding the line right so I bought this one and love it.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer, cheap base
customer_reviews.text: I primarily ordered this to use on our very steep hills. I thought the base with wheels would make this quicker and easier than just using a trimmer. After a summer of use the clip that holds the base to the trimmer doesn't hold and constantly falls off. The spring or mechanism holding it in place has weakened and the base falls off with the slightest pressure. Great concept but not great execution.
customer_reviews.author: Tadd Good

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. If you have a big yard it's not going to work for you. It will take 3x as long for you to mow it but if you have a small yard it's perfect. No heavy mower to push or store. Love the dual use part now and edge at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: neil t ward

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good... Little Devil Works Hard!
customer_reviews.text: The ease of use is good. For a smaller tool, it does the job of a big one! Satisfied with the choice and purchase of this Black & Decker 3-n-1. OK MAY I SAY THAT THIS BABY PERFORMS! IT MAY BE SMALL AND ITS PRICE POINT IS PHENOMENAL, BUT THIS BLACK& DECKER PACKS A PERFORMANCE PUNCH LIKE NO OTHER! IF IT EVER QUITS, I WILL PURCHASE A NEW ONE WITHOUT A THOUGHT! BRAVO BLACK & DECKER FOR ALWAYS DELIVERING, BRAVO! Thanks to Amazon.Com for carrying it!
customer_reviews.author: JeMicheSunshine

customer_reviews.title: I would give it 10 stars if I could!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this 10 stars I would...This is the best purchase of the year and I purchase alot o Amazon! This little machine is the best creation since sliced bread ! It chops down tall thick weeds...it doesn't kick rocks it doesn't kick dirt ..Im in love..if this baby broke down tomorrow I would HAVE to have another one asap because it is that good!! Money well spent its all I can say!
customer_reviews.author: Avanator88

customer_reviews.title: Love it ❤️ I call it my Mario Cart ❤️
customer_reviews.text: Omg I am so in love with this Item and I would give it a thumbs up 👍🏼 and 5 ⭐️‘s It’s a Black and Decker and it lives up to the reputation! Well made and so easy to put together !!️ Can’t wait to use it 😊 6/10/20 I will update later, after I give it a try 😉
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Little Beast
customer_reviews.text: This little things is a beast I have a large back yard with weeds grass and rocks and this thing handles like a champ! It's like vacuuming my back yard and the option to pull off deck and use a weed eat is a bonus ! Totally worth the money !!!
customer_reviews.author: Lora Dragovich

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: The best little mower I could have gotten. My front yard is a hill and this thing helps me tame it without having to pull out my heavy mower. I can do sections of my yard and not be overwhelmed with its upkeep. Light enough to use as a trimmer and the cord lasts a long time with not jamming. Easy to replace too.
customer_reviews.author: DeAnne L.

customer_reviews.title: Good for short term use
customer_reviews.text: Bought it when I moved into a house for the first time. Figured I'd save money and get a multipurpose tool. It worked for a while but after the 7th use 6 months later the wheel in the deck snapped off. I'm not sure what happened or what could have cuased it but it just snapped while I was pushing it through some grass. It worked great up to that point. I kind of regret not just getting a standard lawn mower. It's also a little hard to clean as there are a lot of groves in the bottom of the deck.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant concept that works well in a small yard
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant: light weight, easy to assemble and use. I have difficulty starting our gas mower but found this Black and Decker on line. Mine uses a power cable. Great concept that really works well on my small plot of grass, and I can whack the weeds in the back yard too! Unfortunately the trimmer developed a problem after 4 months: Black and Decker replaced it under warranty. However, I don't have a Black and Decker service center near my home so had to pay to send it to one.
customer_reviews.author: Reader Ruth

customer_reviews.title: I took the suggestion of another reviewer and fed a better line at the recommended thickness
customer_reviews.text: This mower is not worth the trouble. The auto spool feature is perhaps the biggest issue with this model. It literally feeds the entire thing out. I go through 2 spools for my townhouse. A 3 pack of spool is $20.00. I took the suggestion of another reviewer and fed a better line at the recommended thickness. Just as bad performance. My lawn is littered with bits and pieces of line. Great idea, horrible HORRIBLE execution.
customer_reviews.author: Arman

customer_reviews.title: Very cheaply made. More toylike than I expected. ...
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply made. More toylike than I expected. While mowing the lawn the attachment came loose and chewed up part of the base. For another $70-$80 I could have gotten something of more substance. I was sent a second mower due to a delivery mix up, and even though my first mower was partially destroyed the first day, I wasn't even tempted to keep the second unit. When, cutting the grass out front, it's almost embarrassing to use this thing. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: The item works as advertised but not easy to push in taller grass or a bumpy yard ...
customer_reviews.text: The item works as advertised but not easy to push in taller grass or a bumpy yard with the wheels set on the lowest setting. It is also much noisier than I expected probably because of the plastic deck acting like a drum. I use this to cut a 12' by 30' fenced off area I have for my dog. It only takes me a few minutes. It is kind of like pushing a vacuum cleaner around. But it does the job and I am overall pleased with the product. I have not used it yet without the deck but the trimmer seems to have lots of power.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and versatile
customer_reviews.text: It’s lightweight it would seem like a piece of junk if you had a big lawn or high grass that you need heavy lawnmower for but I have a duplex with tiny front yard it’s (perfect) for that then when done mowing I used the weed eater as edger it has a wheel you roll it on works great I need practice though
customer_reviews.author: Lillyoe

customer_reviews.title: Ordered the wrong one....but it worked out!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what I was thinking when I ordered this....it is clearly not what I wanted. BUT I actually like it! I have a small yard and it worked! It's like running the vacuum except in my yard and yes, it took more work but I love how neat my yard now looks and with the added benefit of a weed whacker and an edger, it is well worth keeping. I ordered the corded one and after reading the reviews, I am glad I did. I don't have to worry about the battery dying and stopping to recharge it. If you don't have a lot of yard, this is well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Could be worse?
customer_reviews.text: Definitely an improvement from the old spinning push mower I was using. Is it good? No. Are there worse alternatives? Yes. Cuts unevenly. Any meaningful gowth will bog it down. Takes several passes to get everything cut. Wheels don't stay at increased cut height. Pops out of deck housing. Overall looking forward to never using it again.
customer_reviews.author: Popevader

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart just using it for no more than 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: Fell apart just using it for no more than 10 minutes. I bought this mainly for the "lawn mower" effect. Went together very easily. However, just about 10 minutes into using, the mower part would not stay on the edger end. When I looked closer, the "lip" of the mower part that the edger is supposed to attach is coming apart and won't hold the mower/edger together. Great concept, but product sucks. . .to put it mildly.
customer_reviews.author: Ena Carr

customer_reviews.title: Light and easy to handle.
customer_reviews.text: I just received this item. I was a bit skeptical but it fits MY needs perfectly. I am in my 70s and petite. I was in need of a tool that I could manage easily (in the heat) in my garden/kennel areas. This is perfect. I just tried it out and it does the job nicely. It is basically a string trimmer mounted onto a rolling frame that makes it easy to move across the areas that are in need of a trim. We have heavy duty riding mowers and push trimmers but they are either too big to fit this limited area or too hard for me to start (pull start). I am very happy with this item.
customer_reviews.author: gsdwalker

customer_reviews.title: My "True Love" . . . ?
customer_reviews.text: There's a Youtube video of a nice man putting it together and giving general explanations. Thank you from a macular degenerate! Considering all the whining about battery life, I am glad I got the corded kind. It only needs a medium duty type and I just throw it over my shoulder and tango with it. No problemo. I am very impressed so far, and definitely am in love, but having been disillusioned before (and alas, am currently awaiting a replacement for a larger, electric mower that mechanically and psychically disappointed me in less than six months), I dare not hope: Could this finally be the one? My faithful, little love? (If so, I'll add a star in a year.)
customer_reviews.author: go-lucky

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Does what it is supposed to do. I have a small back yard and I use it to cut the grass, trim and edge. Works particularly well as a trimmer. The replacement spools are not expensive, especially if you do a little shopping. The grass mowing functionality is ok, but not great. The connection between the trimmer and the mower is a little flimsy, but I've had this for a few months and it's done everything I wanted it to do. Not perfect but good product
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Workman

customer_reviews.title: NOT BATTERY POWERED AS LISTED!!
customer_reviews.text: This item listed a charging time, and the description below listed it as cordless. This is a corded model, and Amazon has it listed incorrectly. I sent it back, hoping either the seller or Amazon would get the hint and update the listing!
customer_reviews.author: Scott A

customer_reviews.title: Product dies on second use and warranty experience is awful.
customer_reviews.text: It died on it's second use. Normally this wouldn't bother me as I know a warranty will cover the product, but going through the warranty process has been an awful experience. First off, the warranty information is out of date, the product is not warranted by Spectrum like the manual states. When trying to navigate through the Black and Decker website, it is non-responsive and there is no clear area regarding warranties. I am also used to being able to send back a product when faulty, but in this case they require that you go to a service center, which is 20 miles away. This will be the last time I purchase any Black and Decker products.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: This one is super light but powerful
customer_reviews.text: This thing has been a back saver! We have a gas powered weed eater but it is heavy and a pain to pull start. This one is super light but powerful. It can be a pain to drag the cord around but it beats toting the heavy one to me. We have ditches around our house and they can get pretty dense and thick - they are still no match for this weed eater. I don't use the wheeled base too much but it is nice to have every once in a while.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great for hard to get to areas, but no "always on" switch position....
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I needed for an area I have which is almost impossible to move a real lawn mower to. Easy to put together, though the directions were not very clear - all pictures which didn't detail that you have to screw the back part on before trying to put it together as a lawn mowing unit. I like the telescoping handle - you can have it the height that works for you. Using it is kinda like vacuuming your carpet. The only bad thing is that there is No Way to leave the unit on - you have to squeeze the handle the entire time.... Hence 4 stars rather than 5.
customer_reviews.author: Martha R. Dienst

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: I made changes in my home life last year; I sold my house and purchased a townhouse. After landscaping my front and back yards, there is very little area needed to mow and trim. This is perfect for me, 65 year old woman. It is easy to use - much like using a bacuum cleaner with a push and pull action. I bought the electric operated, so there are no battery to keep charged and has strong power. It stores easily in my outside storage area. I watched you tube reviews/operating video before purchasing - and I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE!  CORD SHOWN WITH ITEM DOES NOT FIT TRIMMER!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the electric cord shown as "also bought with Black & Decker MTE 912 trimmer". IT DOES NOT FIT THE TRIMMER!!! Do not buy this item if you are planning on plugging the trimmer directly into it. The trimmer has a two-pronged plug in a recess on the handle and the receptacle on this cord is three-pronged and much to big to fit into recess on trimmer. Unable to use trimmer until this is solved. Not a happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Feet

customer_reviews.title: Burned out motor on 3rd use.
customer_reviews.text: Mowed small lawn twice. Did the job fine. Used it to weed eat some taller weeds and the grass wrapped around the horn, getting caught in the gap. Stopped to pull out as much as I could. Did this for about 5 minutes, then the motor burned out. It is a shame since it is a nice, light weight machine.
customer_reviews.author: Mom~

customer_reviews.title: One Very Happy Husband
customer_reviews.text: My husband is absolutely thrilled with this mower. He said it is extremely easy to handle, and clean. He no longer has to buy fuel, or maintain a mower's motor. The edging wheel makes edging a breeze. He's able to mow and edge with one very convenient tool. It folds down for easy storage, and hardly takes up any space.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my campsite where I have a lot of loose gravel along with the grass and weeds. I am over 65 and find a weed eater too heavy so this is perfect for me!!! I roll it all over the campsite. Stones don't go flying but it cuts the weeds and grass with ease. I didn't rate it a 5 only because I wish the handle was longer so I could stand straighter. Also, the weed eater part pops out of the base really easily without even using the release. (Yes, I am sure it had snapped in completely.}
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Nuccie

customer_reviews.title: Manage that grass!
customer_reviews.text: OMG! I love mowing the lawn! Never thought I’d ever say that. This is the best ever, using the mower deck feels like vacuuming the lawn into a neat place. The weed wacker use and edger use is great also. I have a small enough yard to not mind the cord trailing behind, but I think I saw this model with a rechargeable battery for larger spaces. Can’t say enough positive about this lawn tool!
customer_reviews.author: J. Archer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS!!! This was a gift for myself and it's been my favorite!! I wasn't strong enough to start our lawn mower, so I bought this hoping it would help me contribute to the lawn duties!! This amazing trimmer/mower is lightweight and easy to use. In fact, it's so easy in the mower mode, that my 4 year old was able to use it...while I was right next to her watching her like a hawk :D I must say, it is also pretty powerful. It took down some nasty tall weeds that were about an inch in diameter. Bottom line...you will not be disappointed with this product!!!
customer_reviews.author: jab

customer_reviews.title: GOODBYE BACK PAIN!!!
customer_reviews.text: This weed wacker is the answer to all my life's problems!!!!! In a world where there is little time for chores, the thing is AMAZING!!! EASY TO USE. LIGHTWEIGHT. I have a small fenced in yard with a pool and garden. THIS WAS PERFECT....what ised to take me 30 minutes, now takes me 10..
customer_reviews.author: JOSIE

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small yards and natural ares
customer_reviews.text: I have an elevated backyard and getting a mower up the steps to it is difficult, and when I'm finished there is not storage available so it has to be brought back down to the garage. This is the perfect solution and it was so easy to use and carry.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Works like a dream. Love that it's 12". Last B&D weed eater was battery. Decided to try corded model this time & glad I did. Not as heavy. Edges perfectly. Lawn mower attachment is simple to use and cuts as well as our old gas mower. Cuts thru weeds & very tall thick grass easily. Height adjustment on mower is easy to set & cuts as described. Length & extra handle adjustments are great features when users are different heights.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small yards and lawn We use it for ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for small yards and lawn We use it for our yard and so far it's the best than using those bulky mowers or hiring someone to do the yard work This is the wired version and so far no issues with a long extensible cord we are able to reach all corners of the yard and also best thing is no yard waste left behind. Very light weight and portable easily stored in the garage. Anyone looking for a lawn mower for small yard this is the best.
customer_reviews.author: sea_staring12

customer_reviews.title: great without the usuless attachment.
customer_reviews.text: don't buy this unless you find it for the same price as without the 'mower' gimmick. you'll remove it, never put it back on, and it'll sit in the garage til you finally toss it in the garbage. again though, the wacker is great.
customer_reviews.author: Stride

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I normally don't post reviews, but felt obliged to do this one. This was a great buy! I have a very small yard, but too much to just use a weedwhacker. This little guy is so easy to use and small enough to store away. It looks like a kids toy lawnmower. Im a little intimidated to use gas tools so I like just plugging it in. The box was light and putting together took one Phillips screw. You can adjust the height too.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: I'm Finally Willing to Mow the Lawn
customer_reviews.text: Wow this is great! We have a front yard on the smaller side and this tool makes it so easy to mow, edge, and trim. It's fast. Switching between modes is very easy. I can mow with one hand and there's no gas to worry about. One tool does the whole job. Love it! It seemed to use the weed-eater cord too fast; I'll edit this comment later if I think it's a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: The bigger your lawn maintenance toys, the handier this is. I can go "vacuum" around my orchard trees and easily get those spots I missed with the riding mower. It really is about as effortless as it can be to clean up the hard-to-get-to spots. After using it, I wish I had shelled out the extra hundred for the cordless, but this is going to be just fine. Getting an extention cord for it is a little bit of a challenge. The guard around the plug-in slot is small. None of my three-pronged cords would fit. So be sure to count that extra cord you may have to buy against the price for the cordless model.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Great for smaller lawns.
customer_reviews.text: This is great for our 300-400 ft2 of lawn. Using this mower is more like vacuuming a carpet than mowing - it moves lightly and easily but you have to zig-zag back and forth. It is light enough that the slope is no problem. If you have a big yard, you probably will want to invest in a larger mower to cover more ground, but for small yards it's definitely a lot easier than the manual option. It's also a nice edger and keeps our lawn looking pretty tidy.
customer_reviews.author: MrIncognito

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for campground.
customer_reviews.text: I love this little thing. It’s lighter than some vacuum cleaners I’ve purchased. Easy to assemble, easy to use and cuts well. Perfect for keeping the lot mowed on the campground.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Clark

customer_reviews.title: It works .
customer_reviews.text: We now have a very small patch of grass for our dog. We used to have a large back yard so electric lawn mower was great. We just bought this Black and Decker 12 in. Used it right away it’s just great for our area ,but I think it would work on any small to medium job. It took more time and effort to clean it than it was to mow and trim our yard.
customer_reviews.author: e_whospends_money

customer_reviews.title: Love This Tool
customer_reviews.text: Actually i cannot compare this to other string trimmers but I am completely happy with it. My garden does not have heavy brush so was good on all weeds and grass. Had enough power for my particular use. I found it very satisfying to use, easy to assemble even without reading the directions and also to store.
customer_reviews.author: CDrobek

customer_reviews.title: Great idea that works well
customer_reviews.text: It is very easy to remove the weed eater from the cart and just as easy to replace it. I use the cart for large areas that are too steep or narrow to ride a mower across. I use it as a handheld weed eater for areas that are close to the house. I wanted to cut a large area of weeds close to the house where two small sunflowers were growing among the weeds. I was able to maneuver the weed eater around the sunflowers and still eliminate the weeds.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Housing Will Not Stay On
customer_reviews.text: I love the trimmer itself, but detest the plastic, flimsy mower housing. For one thing, it doesn't stay connected to the trimmer; and I cannot figure out why...it might be defective. Either way I'll keep it, my lawn is small and it beats paying lawn services 80 bucks a month in south Georgia!
customer_reviews.author: Mermaidbones

customer_reviews.title: I have a gas powered weed whacker that is not ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a gas powered weed whacker that is not automatic feed. Apparently I haven't gotten the hang of banging the whacker to get the string to advance. The B&D has an automatic feeder. This really sped up my job. It just kept going and going, until I ran out of string. One negative I want to note is that the snap on adjustable handle would self adjust at inopportune times with no warning. This did cause me to stop and readjust the angle of the handle. This is fairly insignificant when I put it up against the self feeding feature. Thank you RM
customer_reviews.author: yourobli

customer_reviews.title: Great mower for small lawns
customer_reviews.text: I love this mower. I have a small lawn, less than 2000 SQFT and I always used a weed whacker. I did so because it was easier to store, but it left my lawn uneven. This leave my lawn even, and also makes it super quick to mow. It feels like I'm vacuuming the lawn. It also automatically releases more string when it gets too short. I have no problems with the corded one.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest quality
customer_reviews.text: Let me save you all some trouble. You'll be able to mow your small lawn several times. But the lip that the design engineers at Black+DECKER didn't provide a sustainable enough 'lip' for the trimmer to connect to the base. After a few uses, the plastic lip will bend/deform, and you'll be unable to use the base/wheel attachment.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Crow

customer_reviews.title: I loved it but thought I would wait to review after ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lawnmower a year ago in the Fall and only used it once. I loved it but thought I would wait to review after I used it more. I have to say it’s the best product I’ve bought in years. Worth its weight in gold. Wish I had bought this years ago. I’m 76 and thought I would have to hire someone to take care of my very steep bank. Thanks to this product, I’ve got it covered. Thank you Black + Decker. A very satisfied lady.
customer_reviews.author: joeybird

customer_reviews.title: Caution! Not for 3 prong extension cord!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great... My complaint is that my 3 prong extension cord didn't fit in the hole on the top.... I had use a mini saw to cut out the plastic to fit it in. It's a 2 prong fit... Very silly this product wouldn't beade to accommodate the most common extension cord.
customer_reviews.author: PolarBear24

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER 3-in-1 String Trimmer/Edger & Lawn Mower, 6.5-Amp, 12-Inch (MTE912)
product_meta.description: Style:3-in-1 Corded MowerAll in one lawn mower, string trimmer, and edger. Offering the ultimate in small yard and garden versatility, the innovative BLACK+DECKER 3 N 1 trimmer/edger and mower gives you three types of landscaping functionality in a single, compact tool. Thanks to its small footprint design, this an ideal mower, string trimmer, and edger for homes with small yards of up to 1,200 square feet, as well as yards with small inclines or difficult to reach areas. It's also a great solution for homes with limited storage space. This model (MTE912) is the corded version (with 6.5 Amp motor), but it's also available in a cordless version so you can choose the right option for your yard. Ultimate Versatility The 3 N 1 features a durable mower base deck with four wheels that secures a BLACK+DECKER string trimmer/edger with a 12 inch cutting swath. A foot pedal release allows for quick insertion and removal of the trimmer/edger as you move from mowing to trimming or edging. The mower deck also features two height adjustment options that raises or lowers all four wheels. Foot pedal release for quick change. The 12 inch trimmer/edger features a gear driven transmission to maintain constant speed that won?t bog down while trimming, and AFS Auto Feed System for continuous and automatic line advancement without the need for bumping. It also offers a lightweight ergonomic design with adjustable height and handle positions, which provide maximum comfort and control. What's in the Box: MTE912 3 N 1 corded trimmer/edger and mower, detachable mower deck (MTD100), one spool of trimmer string, auxiliary handle, guard, operating instructions. Included Components: GH912 Corded 12" string trimmer, (1) MTD100 detachable mower deck, (1) AF 100, (1) Auxiliary Handle, (1) Guard; Power Source: Electric.Easy conversion wheeled edging just rotate to convert from trimmer to edger.
feature_bullets: AFS automatic feed system ensures continual work without bumping or having to stop
Gear Drive transmission prevents bogging down
The 6.5 Amp motor provides Maximum performance
Does not come with an extension power cord
Ideal Property Size: 750 feet. Charge Time at 100 percent 4 hrs. Charge Time at 60 percent 2.5 hrs

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars2,013 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
